English: Three weeks later
Castle ruins
Good luck, Russian.
Destroying those helicopters will seal our victory on the island. Everon is a stepping stone and Malden the price.
Whatever is there, Volkov is close to getting it. The time to act is to be soon upon us. Will I be ready?
Get it together, Grigory! I must not falter!
Many fires mean many guards... And Montignac is around the corner... I have to be quick...
Veni, vidi, vici...
Something's off...
The station's burning... like the hearts of patriotic men...
How much more will I have to destroy before the end?
All their naval might and still they cannot stop us. What can?
Rearm and get back into the fray.
There should be substantially less patrols at the air base. It is time to strike.
There are three directions they can come from. I have to hold out until the others can get here.
And so our great fortress falls to the enemy.\nI weep for our lost brothers.
The Soviets triggered it by their arrival. They bring destruction whenever they go, as always.
This was a long time coming, Jean, and you know that. We just have to regroup in the north.
What do we have left to even regroup? We've lost a lot, Gaston.\nIf the Soviets decide to turn against us we wouldn't be able to hold them, not anymore.
I am aware, Jean, but they are not. We are not beaten yet.\nRemember, the battle is not over until there are people still willing to fight on.
We only lost a battle, but the war is far from over! We got through worse situations!\nWe just have to push on and bring out the very best in us.
As long we breathe, we fight for free Everon! Long live the Resistance!
For free Everon! Long live Gaston! Long live the resistance!
A grand speech to boost morale, I presume? Did it have to be so loud?
We're fighting for a noble and just cause. A Soviet dog wouldn't understand.
Jean, be nicer to our guest. He fought valiantly and helped us out. Soviet or not, I recognize a good man when I see one.
Lemontov, was it? Are you coming with us?
If I may, yes. There will be more of my colleagues coming over in the next few days.\nWe'll have a lot of work to do before our invasion forces arrive.
Good, we shall help each other out. Onwards, men! There's nothing left for us here.
DMITRY 2 TO DMITRY 1, HOW IS IT GOING, COMRADE MAJOR? WE ARE ON OUR WAY TO OUR TARGET, OVER.
DON'T BOTHER WITH CALL SIGNS, KAPLINSKY. THEY KNOW VERY WELL WE ARE HERE AND WHAT OUR TARGETS ARE. I'M JUST LEAVING THE CAMP. WILL CALL ONCE THE MISSION'S DONE, OUT.
THE AIR BASE IS OUT OF SERVICE. GOING BACK TO THE BASE, OVER.
GOOD WORK, COMRADE MAJOR. WE'RE ALSO ABOUT TO GO BACK. SEE YOU IN THE CAMP. OUT.
KAPLINSKY, GET YOUR ASS OVER HERE THIS INSTANT! I'M ABOUT TO GET FUCKED UP BY AMERICAN SPECIAL FORCES! WHERE ARE YOU?
WE ARE COMING, COMRADE LEMONTOV! GOING AS FAST AS WE CAN! HOLD ON IN THE CAMP, WE'RE COMING!
DO NOT WORRY, COMRADE LEMONTOV. I ALWAYS HAVE YOUR BACK.
THIS TIME, KAPLINSKY, I CAN SAY - GOOD WORK.
THE REBELS ARE ALL DEAD?
NO BODIES, THEY MUST HAVE BEEN TAKEN PRISONER. WE'RE DONE HERE, WE ARE MOVING NORTH!
